You guys can have an endless impossible debate about where Kerry was at what time while he was in Vietnam, or whether he threw his medals or his ribbons over a fence after Vietnam, on his performance in Vietnam, on whether he deserved the Purple Hearts he received while in Vietnam, on why he opposed the war when he came back from Vietnam, but in the end, what counts is that he was in Vietnam. Need I say more?
Bush Is The Man

You guys can have an endless impossible debate about where Kerry was at what time while he was in Vietnam, or whether he threw his medals or his ribbons over a fence after Vietnam, on his performance in Vietnam, on whether he deserved the Purple Hearts he received while in Vietnam, on why he opposed the war when he came back from Vietnam, but in the end, what counts is that he was in Vietnam. Need I say more?

 
 
 
 Since when does being in Vietnam entitle you to lie about what went on there? Do you think that since he was in Vietnam he is entitled to some special treatment where we have to believe everything he says, even though 250+ people who lived with him for 4 and a half months think differently? They deserve the exact same respect as he does. And they have pointed out that Kerry lied about being in Cambodia and about throwing his medals away. And then he came back to the US and testified that his fellow soldiers were war criminals, even though he said that he himself committed these atrocities too. 
 
 
 And this thread is about a cartoon, and I turned it into another joke about Kerry throwing his medals away. Don't have a heart attack over this.

Actually, depending on your definition of "Washington Pundit," I am one.
 
 Pundit, n.: A source of opinion, a critic.
 
 A Washington Pundit is presumably someone who lives in or around DC. I live approximately 5 minutes from our nation's capital (inside the beltway), and run my own political website that is a "source of opinion." Ergo, I'm a "Washington Pundit." Does that mean I suddenly "know alot more" than anyone else on this site?
 
 My list is all-inclusive for every vote Kerry has cast dating back to fall of 2003. I can keep going if you'd like, but I'd like some guarentee of response for the work I've already done before I do more.
 
 I believe you when you say there are issues you oppose Bush on, just as there are issues I oppose Kerry on. All I'm saying is a debate on those issues (and the issues where there is clash) is FAR more constructive than 140525065035 posts on Vietnam.
